key_dates.event: EU AI Act adopted by European Parliament and Council
key_dates.impact_on_product: Begin processing regulation content. Start building compliance framework.

key_dates.event: Published in Official Journal of the European Union
key_dates.impact_on_product: Official text available. Finalize regulatory parsing.

key_dates.event: Entry into force (20 days after publication)
key_dates.impact_on_product: Regulation is law. Countdown timers start for all phases.

key_dates.event: Phase 1: Prohibited practices (Art. 5) and AI literacy (Art. 4) apply
key_dates.impact_on_product: Prohibited practices screening and AI literacy modules must be live. Article 5 checklist and training templates must be available.

key_dates.event: Commission published Guidelines on Prohibited AI Practices and AI System Definition
key_dates.impact_on_product: Update prohibited practices screening logic and definition matching based on official guidelines.

key_dates.event: Phase 2: GPAI rules apply. Governance bodies operational. Penalty regime in force.
key_dates.impact_on_product: GPAI compliance modules must be live. Annex XI/XII documentation templates available. Code of Practice integration. Penalty calculator active.

key_dates.event: GPAI Code of Practice finalized and published
key_dates.impact_on_product: Integrate Code of Practice requirements into GPAI provider workflow. Update technical documentation templates.

key_dates.event: Member States designate national competent authorities. Penalty rules notified.
key_dates.impact_on_product: Build authority directory per Member State. Enable jurisdiction-specific penalty calculations. Map enforcement contacts.

key_dates.event: Commission published first draft Code of Practice on marking/labeling AI-generated content
key_dates.impact_on_product: Update content marking SDK requirements per Code of Practice. Integrate C2PA and marking standards referenced.

key_dates.event: Expected: Commission guidelines on high-risk AI classification (detailed examples for Annex III categories)
key_dates.impact_on_product: Update risk classification questionnaire with official examples and edge cases. Refine classification logic.

key_dates.event: Phase 3: MAJORITY OF PROVISIONS APPLY. High-risk AI (Annex III) rules. Transparency (Art. 50). Deployer obligations (Art. 26). FRIA (Art. 27). Registration (Art. 49). Sandboxes (Art. 57). Post-market monitoring (Art. 72). Incident reporting (Art. 73).
key_dates.impact_on_product: CRITICAL DEADLINE. All deployer and provider modules for high-risk AI must be fully operational. FRIA templates, monitoring dashboards, incident reporting workflows, EU database registration guidance, transparency compliance (disclosure + content marking) all live. This is the main enforcement date.

key_dates.event: GPAI administrative fines (Art. 101) become enforceable by AI Office
key_dates.impact_on_product: Update penalty information for GPAI providers. Ensure GPAI compliance scoring reflects enforcement risk.

key_dates.event: Phase 4: Full enforcement. Annex II high-risk (product safety AI). Legacy GPAI compliance deadline.
key_dates.impact_on_product: All remaining modules operational. Product safety AI compliance workflows. Full cross-regulation scoring. Legacy GPAI provider remediation tracking.

key_dates.event: Expected: Harmonised standards for AI published by European standardisation organisations (CEN/CENELEC)
key_dates.impact_on_product: Integrate harmonised standards references into conformity assessment workflows. Update technical requirements against formal standards.

key_dates.event: Commission evaluation of AI Office functioning (Art. 112)
key_dates.impact_on_product: Monitor for potential structural changes in enforcement landscape.

key_dates.event: Commission evaluation of impact/effectiveness of voluntary codes of conduct (Art. 112)
key_dates.impact_on_product: Monitor for potential shift from voluntary to mandatory for minimal-risk AI.

key_dates.event: Commission review of entire AI Act — potential amendments to scope, classification, governance
key_dates.impact_on_product: Major review cycle. Prepare for potential framework changes. Monitor legislative proposals.

key_dates.event: Large-scale IT systems in AFSJ (Annex X) compliance deadline
key_dates.impact_on_product: Final compliance deadline for legacy systems in justice/security domain.

expected_amendments: Digital Omnibus Package (proposed 2025): Commission proposed simplification amendments including adjusting high-risk timeline to link application to availability of harmonised standards. May extend some deadlines by up to 16 months.
Potential amendment to Annex III: Commission can expand or modify the high-risk use case list through delegated acts (Art. 7). Monitor for new high-risk categories.
GPAI systemic risk threshold: The 10^25 FLOPs threshold may be revised as compute capabilities evolve (Art. 51(3)).
Content marking standards: Technical standards for AI content marking are still being developed. Expect updates to implementation requirements.

codes_of_practice.title: General-Purpose AI Code of Practice
codes_of_practice.description: Voluntary guidelines for GPAI model providers covering transparency, documentation, copyright compliance, and safety testing.

codes_of_practice.title: Code of Practice on Marking and Labelling AI-Generated Content
codes_of_practice.description: Guidelines for machine-readable marking of AI-generated content (images, audio, video, text). Covers C2PA, watermarking, and metadata standards.

codes_of_practice.title: Harmonised Standards for AI (CEN/CENELEC)
codes_of_practice.description: Formal European harmonised standards for AI systems. When published, compliance with these standards provides presumption of conformity with AI Act requirements.

monitoring_sources: https://ai-act-service-desk.ec.europa.eu/ — Official EU AI Act Service Desk
https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/ — Comprehensive AI Act reference (Future of Life Institute)
EU AI Office announcements — monitor for enforcement actions, guidelines, and delegated acts
timeline.review_frequency: monthly — critical regulatory implementation period through August 2027. Switch to quarterly after full enforcement.

version.source_regulation_version: Regulation (EU) 2024/1689 as published in OJ L 2024/1689
version.last_regulatory_update_checked: 2025-12-17 (Code of Practice on content marking draft)
version.notes: Production-grade framework with granular obligation decomposition, full what_not_to_do coverage, expanded deployer obligations, and comprehensive tech specs for scanner.
